contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Settlement | name = Jeongseon | native_name = 정선 | native_name_lang = ko | settlement_type = [[List of cities in South Korea|County]] | translit_lang1 = Korean | translit_lang1_type1 = Hangul | translit_lang1_info1 = {{linktext|정|선|군}} | translit_lang1_type2 = Hanja | translit_lang1_info2 = {{linktext|旌|善|郡}} | translit_lang1_type3 = {{nowrap|Revised Romanization}} | translit_lang1_info3 = Jeongseon-gun | translit_lang1_type4 = {{nowrap|McCune-Reischauer}} | translit_lang1_info4 = Chŏngsŏn-gun | image_skyline = | imagesize = | image_caption = | image_map = Gangwon-Jeongseon.svg | mapsize = | map_caption = Location in South Korea | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flag|South Korea}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Regions of Korea|Region]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Gwandong]] | population_blank1_title = Dialect | population_blank1 = [[Gangwon dialect|Gangwon]] | area_total_km2 = 1220.67 | population_as_of = 2004 | population_total = 46362 | population_density_km2 = 38 | parts_type = [[Administrative divisions of South Korea|Administrative divisions]] | parts = 4 ''eup'', 5 ''myeon'' | image_blank_emblem = Jeongseon County logo.png | blank_emblem_type = Emblem of Jeongseon }} '''Jeongseon''' (''Jeongseon-gun'') is a [[Administrative divisions of South Korea|county]] in [[Gangwon-do (South Korea)|Gangwon]] Province, [[South Korea]]. It is famous as the hometown of "Jeongseon [[Arirang]]," a traditional Korean folksong. It is also the hometown of famous actor [[Won Bin]] and footballer [[Seol Ki-hyeon]]. ==Administrative divisions== ===Towns (eup)=== * [[Gohan Eup, Jeongseon|Gohan Eup]] * [[Jeonseon Eup, Jeongseon|Jeongseon Eup]] * [[Sabuk Eup, Jeongseon|Sabuk Eup]] * [[Sindong Eup, Jeongseon|Sindong Eup]] ===Townships (myeon)=== * [[Yeoryang Myeon]] * [[Bukpyeong Myeon]] * [[Hwaam Myeon]] * [[Imgye Myeon, Jeongseon|Imgye Myeon]] * [[Nam Myeon, Jeongseon|Nam Myeon]] ==Attractions== High1, a ski resort, is located in Gohan Eup, Gangwonland, the only casino in Korea that is open to South Korean citizens, is also located nearby.<ref>[http://www.visitkorea.or.kr/ena/SI/SI_EN_3_1_1_1.jsp?cid=313272 "Gangwon-do » Jeongseon-gun » High 1 Ski Resort"]</ref> The resort at 1,345 meters is at the highest altitude of the Korean ski resorts.<ref>{{cite news|last=Yoon|first=Chul|title=7 best ski and snowboard resorts in Korea|url=http://www.cnngo.com/seoul/play/7-best-ski-resorts-korea-103896|accessdate=3 June 2012|newspaper=CNN Go|date=27 December 2011}}</ref> ==Events== * [[2018 Winter Olympics]]: the [[Alpine Skiing]] venue will be located in Jungbong, Bukpyeong Township of Jeongseon. ==See also== * [[Geography of South Korea]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.jeongseon.go.kr/JStour_EN/html/sub01_01.html Jeongseon County government home page] {{Gangwon}} {{coord|37.3791666767|N|128.664722232|E|source:ruwiki_region:KR_type:city(46362)|format=dms|display=title}} [[Category:Counties of Gangwon Province (South Korea)]] [[Category:Jeongseon| ]] {{SouthKorea-geo-stub}}
